content: You’re confusing customers paying for the product (song, story, etc) with customers paying the distributor (streaming service, micropayment interface on your blog, etc). Long before the internet existed, the same problem occurred only it was much worse (look up“payola” on a search engine). Today, it’s actually easier to get paid directly for your work. I’m a “creative” and I do it all the time. And I damn sure don’t charge 10 cents for something that took me an hour (or more!) to create. I can’t speak for Drake or whomever, but most famous musicians make most of their money on concerts and merchandise, not streams and royalties. Why? Because their customers aren’t paying the distributor. The ONLY reason to have a distributor is to increase “brand awareness”, not to make money (directly). Also, quit complaining about being criticized. If people went to all the trouble to write you and call you a “sell out” then at least they care. Far worse to be ignored.
